page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT AROUND BERROW
page.content: {Agriculture}is the main employment here, either self_employed or for wages. Some agriculture is seasonal eg. fruit_picking and market gardening; this is often done by housewives. Labour relations generally are good.Many people make money by {producing and selling goods}from their gardens eg. eggs, chickens, lettuce, tomatoes. Unemployed people may suffer less than elsewhere as they can produce more food in their enforced leisure. There are some{small {employers}running pubs, shops and a garage, and one agricultural engineer. Some women do local domestic work. Many people travel to work outside the area _ eg. in Tewkesbury, Ledbury, Malvern and as far afield as Birmingham. There are retired people in the area.
